description.value:
This bag superficially resembles a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.aDHRuUs29SrumWfq]{bag of holding} but is a feeding orifice for a gigantic extradimensional creature. Turning the bag inside out is difficult, requiring a Strength check DC 25, but on a success it closes the orifice and expels what is inside of the bag. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Reaching into the bag and retrieving an item requires an action .

The extradimensional creature attached to the bag can sense whatever is placed inside the bag. Animal or vegetable matter placed wholly in the bag is devoured and lost forever. When part of a living creature is placed in the bag, as happens when someone reaches inside it, there is a 50 percent chance that the creature is pulled inside the bag. A creature inside the bag can use its action to try to escape with a successful DC 15 Constitution modifier.

Inanimate objects can be stored in the bag, which can hold a cubic foot of such Material to attempt to consume anyone that would place the object back inside of it . The GM determines the time and plane.

If the bag is pierced or torn, it is destroyed, and anything contained within it is transported to a random location on the Astral Plane. (Requires a DC 25 Strength check or 50+ piercing/slashing damage).

In extremely rare situations, it is possible to build a tenuous relationship with the bag of devouring which involves contacting the extradimensional creature via the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.FlEItcatjuGvT8L4]{Contact Other Plane}, the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.MbQBiDyz3F8HmMXg]{Dream}, the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.nWOkLVgIX8mmsUKS]{Telepathic Bond} spells or something similar (at your DM's discretion) all of which only last 1 minute at a time. The creature and in turn the bag can be convinced to not attempt to consume you and others usually be providing it a constant source of something else to devour .
